duties_responsibilities.duty: Maintain and develop customer relationships, both personal and business, to ensure deposit growth and fee income.
Achieve sales performance objectives related to deposit growth, investment, and expense control.
Supervise, coach, and develop branch staff, ensuring adherence to bank best practices, policies, and regulations.
Identify qualified prospects and develop new business relationships through effective sales skills and product recommendation.
Coordinate with Regional Managers and HR on hiring, performance reviews, and employee management.
Meet monthly branch and individual sales goals by monitoring performance and following action plans.
Ensure compliance with bank security, operating policies, and procedures, as well as regulatory requirements.
Participate in branch-local civic organizations to promote bank name, products, and services.
Manage settlement of branch cash and oversee completion of monthly and quarterly branch audits.
Conduct audits and ensure compliance with mystery shops, @ your service standards, and bank marketing materials.
Refer customers to wealth management, brokerage, and commercial representatives as appropriate.
Provide regular team meetings for branch personnel to convey relevant information.
Open and close branch office, adhering to bank’s security policy and procedures.
Promote and discuss consumer lending products with customers within compliance of related guidelines and procedures.
Maintain an active NMLS license by completing all training and annual renewal requirements as required.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree preferred or equivalent work experience;Minimum of five (5) years experience in a management capacity required;Must possess an NMLS license or obtain NMLS license within 90 days of employment
